paragraph.paragraph:
While
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/20_Solution_Explorer/index.xml Debugging a system, it is possible to view the values of all locals of the current
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlfeature feature , and attributes of the current
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlobject Object in which the execution has stopped.
The Locals Window consists of three columns, used to display the relevant information:

list.item:
Name - The name of the local, may also include
Current to represent the current object.

Value - If the object referred to by the Name field is a basic type, then Value will be the value of the object. If it is a reference type, then Value will be its declared .Net type which is displayed in parenthesis.
Type - The Eiffel name corresponding to the Dynamic Type of the object unless it is a non basic .NET type in which case, the .NET name will be displayed.

paragraph.paragraph:
In the screenshot above, the execution of the system has stopped in a
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlfeature feature with three locals :- a, ss and s.
Current is also available and corresponds to the current
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlobject Object in which execution has stopped.
Current - The current object in which execution has stopped. In this case, ROOT_CLASS. All attributes are displayed when the node is expanded.
a - an ARRAY , of INTEGER and currently contains four items.
s - an Eiffel STRING
ss - a .NET
SYSTEM_STRING

The class
ROOT_CLASS has two
Once
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlfeature features ,
io and
operating_environment which do not show up directly in the Locals Window as they are not attributes. However , they do show up indirectly through the
done and
result attributes displayed in the screenshot above. For every Once , an attribute is available, allowing you to see whether the
Once has been executed. The name of this
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlfeature feature corresponds to the name of the
Once , with
_done appended. For example, in the screenshot above, we have
io_done and
operating_environment_done , both of which demonstrate the associated
Once
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlfeature feature has not been executed as they evaluate to False. For every
Once
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlfeature feature which has a return type, an attribute is generated, the value of which is the Result from the
Once , or Void if it has not already been executed. In the screenshot above, we have
io_result and
operating_environment_result .

This ability to see the current state of an
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlobject Object can prove to be a critical component in successful
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/20_Solution_Explorer/index.xml Debugging .
